de.esoco.process

Class ProcessFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • de.esoco.process.ProcessElement
          • de.esoco.process.ProcessFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InteractionFragment, ProcessStep

    public abstract class ProcessFragment
extends ProcessElement
    The base class for all fragments of a process at runtime.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addCleanupAction

        public void addCleanupAction(java.lang.String sKey,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<ProcessFragment> fAction)
        Registers an cleanup action that will be executed when this process fragment is finished, i.e. the fragment is removed, the process continues to the next step, or terminates (regularly or with an error). If a different finish action is already registered under a particular key it will be replaced. Therefore invoking code must make sure to use unique keys or handle the replacement of actions in appropriate ways.

        When invoked a cleanup action receives the process fragment as it's argument to provide access to process parameters. Registered Actions can be removed with removeCleanupAction(String).

        Parameters:
        sKey - A key that identifies the action for later removal
        fAction - The function to invoke on cleanup

        Adds an invisible fill parameter to a layout.
        Parameters:
        bFillWidth - TRUE to fill the remaining layout width
        bFillHeight - TRUE to fill the remaining layout height
        Returns:
        The fill parameter that has been added by this method

      • addSubFragment

        public void addSubFragment(org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>>> rFragmentParam,
                           InteractionFragment rSubFragment)
        Adds a subordinate fragment that handles a part of this interaction and is displayed in a certain parameter. The fragment parameter will not be added to the display parameters on this instance, this must be done separately (e.g. with ProcessElement.addDisplayParameters(RelationType...) to allow the invoking code to separate fragment creation from fragment placement.

        If a fragment already exist in the given parameter it will be replaced with the new instance.

        Parameters:
        rFragmentParam - The interactive process parameter in which the fragment will be displayed
        rSubFragment - The fragment to add

      • getTemporaryParameterType

        public <T> org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> getTemporaryParameterType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                    java.lang.Class<? super T> rDatatype)
        Returns a temporary parameter relation type with a certain name. If the parameter doesn't exist yet it will be created. The name string will be converted to standard relation type notation, i.e. upper case text with separating underscores.

        This method is intended to generate parameter types dynamically at runtime when it is not possible to create the parameters as static constants. The parameters will only be valid for the current process execution and will be removed when the process ends.

        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the parameter type or NULL for a default name
        rDatatype - The datatype class of the type
        Returns:
        The temporary relation type instance

        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the new relation type or NULL to use the simple name of the original type

      • setAllowedElements

        public <T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>,V extends java.util.Collection<T>> void setAllowedElements(org.obrel.core.RelationType<C> rParam,
                                                                                                       V rValues)
        Shortcut method to annotate a collection-type process parameters with the elements that are allowed to occur in the collection. The elements are stored in an ProcessRelationTypes.ALLOWED_VALUES annotation. If the parameter hasn't been set yet it will be initialized with the given value.
        Parameters:
        rParam - The parameter to annotate
        rValues - The list of allowed values for the parameter

      • setAllowedValues

        @SafeVarargs
public final <T> void setAllowedValues(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rParam,
                                                     T... rValues)
        Shortcut method to set the allowed values of a process parameters. The possible values for the parameters are stored in an annotation of type ProcessRelationTypes.ALLOWED_VALUES. If the parameter hasn't been set yet it will be initialized with the given value.
        Parameters:
        rParam - The parameter to annotate
        rValues - The allowed values for the parameter

                               int nRows)

      • spawnProcess

        public void spawnProcess(ProcessDescription rDescription,
                         org.obrel.core.Relatable rInitParams)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Spawns a new process that will run independently from the current process context. If the process is interactive a process state will be created and registered in ProcessRelationTypes.SPAWN_PROCESSES so that it's interaction can be displayed on the client side.
        Parameters:
        rDescription - The process description
        rInitParams - The optional initialization parameters or NULL for none
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the process execution fails

      • checkParameter

        protected <T> T checkParameter(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rParamType)
        Method for subclasses to check and retrieve the value of a certain parameter. Invokes getParameter(RelationType) to retrieve the value and if it is NULL but the parameter has been marked as mandatory an exception will be thrown. Future versions may also check additional conditions, therefore subclasses should always invoke this methods instead of getParameter(RelationType) unless circumventing the parameters checks is explicitly needed.
        Parameters:
        rParamType - The type of the parameter to check and return
        Returns:
        The parameter value (may be NULL for non-mandatory parameters)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the parameter has been marked as mandatory but is NULL

      • executeCleanupActions

        protected void executeCleanupActions()
        Executes all actions that have previously been registered through the method addCleanupAction(String, Consumer).

      • getAbsoluteFilePath

        protected java.lang.String getAbsoluteFilePath(java.lang.String sFileName)
        Returns the absolute path and file name for a relative file path. This will only work if a session manager reference is available from the process parameter DataRelationTypes.SESSION_MANAGER. Otherwise the input path is returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        sFileName - The relative path to the file
        Returns:
        The absolute file path

      • getTemporaryParameterPackage

        protected java.lang.String getTemporaryParameterPackage()
        Returns the package name for temporary parameter types created by the method getTemporaryParameterType(String, Class). Subclasses may override this method to modify the default which creates a package name that is unique for the current process instance (but will be shared by all process steps). The package name must be returned without leading or trailing dots.
        Returns:
        The package name for temporary parameter types

      • performParameterValidations

        protected java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,java.lang.String> performParameterValidations(java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<?,java.lang.String>> rValidations)
        Performs the actual parameter validation for this process element by executing the validation functions on the parameter values. The argument is a mapping from parameter relation types to their respective validation functions. The returned map contains a mapping from invalid parameters to the corresponding error message. The map will never be empty and may be modified by the receiver.
        Parameters:
        rValidations - The mapping from parameters to validation functions
        Returns:
        A mapping for all invalid parameters to the corresponding error messages (may be empty but will never be NULL)

      • setDatePeriod

        protected void setDatePeriod(java.util.Date rAroundDate,
                             org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Date> rStartDateParam,
                             org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Date> rEndDateParam,
                             int nCalendarField,
                             int nPeriodSize)
        Sets two date parameters to span a certain date period around a certain date. The resulting start date will be inclusive, the next date exclusive of the requested date range.
        Parameters:
        rAroundDate - The date to calculate the period around
        rStartDateParam - The parameter type for the start date
        rEndDateParam - The parameter type for the end date
        nCalendarField - The calendar field to calculate the period for
        nPeriodSize - The size of the period
